topic.title: Continuity of Care Document (CCD) (V3) - conformance rules

section.p:
This document type was originally based on the Continuity of Care Document (CCD) Release 1.1 which itself was derived from HITSP C32 and CCD Release 1.0.
The Continuity of Care Document (CCD) represents a core data set of the most relevant administrative, demographic, and clinical information facts about a patient's healthcare, covering one or more healthcare encounters. It provides a means for one healthcare practitioner, system, or setting to aggregate all of the pertinent data about a patient and forward it to another to support the continuity of care.
The primary use case for the CCD is to provide a snapshot in time containing the germane clinical, demographic, and administrative data for a specific patient. The key characteristic of a CCD is that the ServiceEvent is constrained to "PCPR". This means it does not function to report new ServiceEvents associated with performing care. It reports on care that has already been provided. The CCD provides a historical tally of the care over a range of time and is not a record of new services delivered. More specific use cases, such as a Discharge Summary, Transfer Summary, Referral Note, Consultation Note, or Progress Note, are available as alternative documents in this guide.

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] effectiveTime (CONF:5256, R2.1=CONF:1198-5256)
Signifies the document creation time, when the document first came into being. Where the CDA document is a transform from an original document in some other format, the ClinicalDocument.effectiveTime is the time the original document is created. The time when the transform occurred is not currently represented in CDA

sdtc:signatureText The sdtc:signatureText extension provides a location in CDA for a textual or multimedia depiction of the signature by which the participant endorses and accepts responsibility for his or her participation in the Act as specified in the Participation.typeCode. Details of what goes in the field are described in the HL7 CDA Digital Signature Standard balloted in Fall of 2013.
Note: The signature can be represented either inline or by reference according to the ED data type. Typical cases for CDA are:
1) Electronic signature: this attribute can represent virtually any electronic signature scheme.
2) Digital signature: this attribute can represent digital signatures by reference to a signature data block that is constructed in accordance to a digital signature standard, such as XML-DSIG, PKCS#7, PGP, etc.

ol.li: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] templateId ( CONF:8450, CONF:10038 ) such that it SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @root="2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.1.2"
SHALL conform to General Header Constraints template (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.1.1)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code (CONF:17180)/@code="34133-9" Summarization of Episode Note (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.6.1 LOINC) (CONF:17181)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] languageCode (CONF-5)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] documentationOf, where its type is Documentation Of (CONF:8452)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document SHALL contain at least one [1..*] author, where its type is Author (CONF:9442)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document SHALL contain [1..1] component such that it (CONF:9445) Conforms to Allergies Section (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.6.1)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document SHALL contain [1..1] component such that it (CONF:9447) Conforms to Medications Section (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.1.1)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document SHALL contain [1..1] component such that it (CONF:9449) Conforms to Problem Section (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.5.1)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document SHALL contain [1..1] component such that it (CONF:9451) Conforms to Procedures Section (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.7.1)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document SHALL contain [1..1] component such that it (CONF:9453) Conforms to Results Section (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.3.1)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document MAY contain [0..1] component such that it (CONF:9455) Conforms to Advance Directives Section (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.21.1)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document MAY contain [0..1] component such that it (CONF:9457) Conforms to Encounters Section (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.22.1)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document MAY contain [0..1] component such that it (CONF:9459) Conforms to Family History Section (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.15)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document MAY contain [0..1] component such that it (CONF:9461) Conforms to Functional Status Section (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.14)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document MAY contain [0..1] component such that it (CONF:9463) Conforms to Immunizations Section Entries Optional (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.2)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document MAY contain [0..1] component such that it (CONF:9466) Conforms to Medical Equipment Section (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.23)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document MAY contain [0..1] component such that it (CONF:9468) Conforms to Payers Section (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.18)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document MAY contain [0..1] component such that it (CONF:9470) Conforms to Plan Of Care Section (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.10)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document MAY contain [0..1] component such that it (CONF:9472) Conforms to Social History Section (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.17)
Consol Continuity Of Care Document MAY contain [0..1] component such that it (CONF:9474) Conforms to Vital Signs Section Entries Optional (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.4)
SHALL conform to CDA Documentation Of
Consol Documentation Of SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] serviceEvent, where its type is Service Event (CONF:8480)
SHALL conform to CDA Service Event
Consol Service Event SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="PCPR" (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass) (CONF:8453)
Consol Service Event SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] effectiveTime (CONF:8481)
Consol Service Event SHOULD contain zero or more [0..*] performer, where its type is Performer (CONF:8482)
SHALL conform to CDA Performer1
Consol Performer SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="PRF" (CONF:8458)
Consol Performer MAY contain zero or one [0..1] assignedEntity, where its type is Assigned Entity (CONF:8459)
Consol Assigned Entity SHOULD include zero or one [0..1] id where id/@root ="2.16.840.1.113883.4.6" National Provider Identifier (CONF:10027)
SHALL conform to CDA Assigned Entity
Consol Assigned Entity MAY contain zero or one [0..1] code, which MAY be selected from (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.6.101 NUCC Health Care Provider Taxonomy) (CONF:8461)
Consol Assigned Entity SHALL contain at least one [1..*] id (CONF:10027)
Consol Effective Time SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] high (CONF:8455)
Consol Effective Time SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] low (CONF:8454)
SHALL conform to CDA Author
Consol Author SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] assignedAuthor, where its type is Assigned Author (CONF:9443)
Consol Assigned Author SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] assignedPerson or exactly one [1..1] representedOrganization. (CONF:8456)

Consol Assigned Author If assignedAuthor has an associated representedOrganization with no assignedPerson or assignedAuthoringDevice, then the value for "ClinicalDocument/author/assignedAuthor/id/@NullFlavor" SHALL be "NA" "Not applicable" 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1008 NullFlavor STATIC. (CONF:8457)
SHALL conform to CDA Assigned Author
